note.p: Education: City of London School (1885-1890). MD, ScD (Camb)

Career: Pioneered the science of industrial psychology; Director, Psychological Laboratory; Reader in Experiment Psychology, Cambridge University; Fellow and Honorary Fellow of Caius College, Cambridge; Consulting Psycologist to the British Armies in France (World War 1); Professor of Psychology, King's College, London; Member, Industrial Research Board
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1945-1948 vol 5 pp 767-777, plate, by F C Bartlett
